   By Tom Feran April 29, 2013

Ohio Oil and Gas Association touts 40,000 new Ohio jobs

   Environmental and economic concerns have been at the center of public
   discussion about the potential benefits and dangers of horizontal
   fracturing, or fracking, to release natural gas and oil from deep shale
   deposits in Ohio.

We are checking the statement, from the OOGA ad, that "nearly
   40,000 new jobs have been created in the last year due to the new wells...
   right here in Ohio."
